title: 820-3662 BIOS Troubles
message:
This board came in with signs of prior repair around the SMC, and U4000/U3900. After removing remainging underfill and properly reflowing the SMC, the unit powered on chimed once and then shut off. PRAM resets would not work, SMC resets would. I tracked it down to a BIOS issue the original BIOS dump had about 4 lines of code and the rest 0s. I found a BIOS dump to test and the unit powers on, PRAM resets, gets starts loading into a bootable USB and then freezes 3/4 of the way through, typical ME problems. I have tried to clean the ME region as I normally do and for the life of me no matter what version 9.0.3..., 9.0.5.1367, or 9.1.... all I get is the original problem with the corrupt BIOS, one chime and then powers off, no PRAM reset. I will upload the original BIOS dump as well as my most recent ME attempt.

[url]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1LCC7FDYD_t3dpWy-B4EGMHM_q774rGBy[/url]

title: 820-3662 BIOS Troubles
message:
[url]https://drive.google.com/file/d/15iOSWzmoeg3SZTNl5xwaQGJS6UNTFkOV/view?usp=sharing[/url]

I doubt the original BIOS is bad. No way it would chime if it was only 4 lines of code.

title: 820-3662 BIOS Troubles
message: With this new BIOS file I still get a single chime and then a black screen and the unit powers down.

title: 820-3662 BIOS Troubles
message: No idea. Could be SMC issue or the standard 3662 shutdown problem that has no solution so far.
